sdp_messages.sdp_message: Your Oracle WebLogic Server Version ${DOMAIN_VERSION} is not actionable for this issue.

Oracle recommends upgrading your Oracle WebLogic Server version ${DOMAIN_VERSION}.%BR%Whenever possible, you should bring your environment(s) to a level where the issue has been addressed.%BR%However, if you feel that is not feasible, then contact Support for patch ID ${PATCH_ID}. Reference: Article ID 1302053.1 - ''How to Locate and Download Patches for WebLogic Server Using My Oracle Support''

sdp_fact.sdp_description: This fact collection gets configuration parameters from the domain config.xml file.
This fact finds the patches installed on WebLogic Server using ``java weblogic.version -verbose``.
This fact finds parameter settings within the domain/config/jdbc .xml files.
sdp_fact.sdp_command: use Xml import $DOMAIN_HOME var $tbl = {} loop $fil (grepDir(catDir($DOMAIN_HOME,'config','jdbc'),'.xml$','i')) {var $cfg = xmlLoadFile(catFile($DOMAIN_HOME,'config','jdbc',$fil)) var $tbl->{$fil} = $rec = {} var $val = $cfg->find(\ 'jdbc-data-source/jdbc-connection-pool-params/pinned-to-thread')->get_data if match($val,'true') var $rec->{'PINNED_TO_THREAD'} = true if $cfg->find(\ 'jdbc-data-source/jdbc-connection-pool-params/statement-cache-type') var $rec->{'STATEMENT_CACHE_TYPE'} = last->get_data if $cfg->find(\ 'jdbc-data-source/jdbc-connection-pool-params/statement-cache-size') var $rec->{'STATEMENT_CACHE_SIZE'} = last->get_data } call setHcveParameter('DOMAIN.JDBC.FILES',$tbl)

sdp_fact.sdp_description: This fact finds parameter settings within the domain/config/jms .xml files.
This fact finds information using WLST on running servers.
sdp_fact.sdp_command:
use Output import $DOMAIN_HOME,$DOMAIN_URL,$DOMAIN_USR call setCurrent($tgt = addTarget('DOM_Req$$',{DOMAIN_HOME=>$DOMAIN_HOME})) call setWasType('WLS',\ catCommand($tgt->get_wlst(true),'common','bin',${AS.CMD:'wlst'}))
# Get heap size for servers set $cod {domainConfig() "serverNames = cmo.getServers() "domainRuntime() "for name in serverNames: " try: " cd("/ServerRuntimes/" + name.getName() + "/JVMRuntime/" +name.getName()) " heapSizeCur = cmo.getHeapSizeCurrent() " heapSizeMax = cmo.getHeapSizeMax() " print "HEAP SIZE = ", name.getName(), heapSizeCur, heapSizeMax " except WLSTException,e: " # Ignore an inactive server " pass "cd("/") "for name in serverNames: " serverName = name.getName() " print "JDBC Server = ", serverName " try: " cd("/ServerRuntimes/" + name.getName() + "/JDBCServiceRuntime/" + \ name.getName() + "/JDBCDataSourceRuntimeMBeans/") " dataSourceList = ls(returnMap='true') " for dataSource in dataSourceList: " try: " cd("/ServerRuntimes/" + name.getName() + "/JDBCServiceRuntime/" + \ name.getName() + "/JDBCDataSourceRuntimeMBeans/" + dataSource) " print 'JDBC Source = ', dataSource " dataSourceContent = ls(returnMap='true') " cd("..") " except WLSTException,e: " pass " except WLSTException,e: " # Ignore an inactive server " pass "cd("/") } var $fil = getTemp('WLS') call sharePassword('wls',basename($DOMAIN_HOME),'wls',$DOMAIN_URL) call setWasLogin($DOMAIN_USR,undef,$DOMAIN_URL) call requestWas($cod,undef,quote($fil,'x')) var ($jdb,$src,$srv,@siz) = ({},{}) loop $lin (grepFile($fil,'\w')) {if match($lin,'^HEAP ') call push(@siz,[split('\s+',value($lin))]) elsif match($lin,'^JDBC Server =') var ($src,$srv) = ('?',value($lin)) elsif ?$srv {if match($lin,'^-r--') {var @val = split('\s+',$lin,3) var $jdb{$srv,$src,$val[1]} = $val[2] } elsif match($lin,'^JDBC Source =') var $src = value($lin) } } call unlinkTemp('WLS')
# Create facts call setHcveParameter('DOMAIN.WLST',\ {HEAPSIZE => [@siz],\ JDBCCONNECT => $jdb})

sdp_rule.name: Domain directory
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the domain directory.

sdp_rule.name: Domain valid?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $DOMAIN_HOME var $fil = catFile($DOMAIN_HOME,'config','config.xml') call setHcveResult(cond(testFile('e',$fil),\ 'isValid',\ concat($DOMAIN_HOME,' invalid')))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the domain directory contains a ``config.xml`` file in its ``config`` subdirectory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The directory location given for the domain is not a valid domain home.
The directory location given for the domain is a valid domain home.

sdp_rule.name: Domain URL
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the domain URL and port.

sdp_rule.name: Domain User Name and Password
sdp_rule.sdp_command: What is the user name for accessing the domain?

import $DOMAIN_URL,$DOMAIN_USR call setHcveVariable('$DOMAIN_PWD') if !hasPassword('wls',$DOMAIN_URL,$DOMAIN_USR) call setPassword('wls',$DOMAIN_URL,$DOMAIN_USR,\ askPassword('What is the password for accessing the domain?')) call setHcveResult(concat($DOMAIN_USR,'/***'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the user name and the password to use to access the domain.

sdp_rule.name: WLS Version
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule determines the three element version of the domain.

sdp_rule.name: Version 10?

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: The domain is not version 10. No further checks will be performed.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule determines if the domain is version 10.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is version 10.

sdp_rule.name: Admin server name?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule finds the admin server name.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The admin server name was not found in the domain directory's ``config.xml`` file. This implies a bad domain installation.
The admin server name was found.

sdp_rule.name: Server names?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule finds the names of the servers in the domain.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The names of the servers in the domain were not found in the domain directory's ``config.xml`` file. This implies a bad domain installation.
The names of the servers in the domain were found.

sdp_rule.name: Installed Patch List
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule displays the patches found.

sdp_rule.name: config.xml Data
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule displays values found in the ``config.xml`` file.

sdp_rule.name: JDBC Configuration
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule displays values found in the JDBC configuration files.

sdp_rule.name: JMS Configuration
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule displays values found in the JDBC configuration files.

sdp_rule.name: JMS bytes-maximum
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.JMS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$nam,'BYTES_MAXIMUM'}) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have bytes-maximum set:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the bytes-maximum setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``help avoid the out-of-memory errors that can occur when Oracle WebLogic JMS Quotas are not defined.``
The domain is subject to ``a JMS Quota not being defined thus large message backlogs could cause out-of-memory errors.``

sdp_rule.name: JMS messages-maximum
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.JMS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$nam,'MESSAGES_MAXIMUM'}) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have message-maximum set:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the JMS messages-maximum setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``help avoid the out-of-memory errors that can occur when Oracle WebLogic JMS Quotas are not defined.``
The domain is subject to ``a JMS Quota not being defined thus large message backlogs could cause out-of-memory errors.``

sdp_rule.name: JDBC pinned-to-thread
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.JDBC.FILES',{})) loop $fil (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$fil,'PINNED_TO_THREAD'}) call push(@tbl,$fil) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have pinned-to-thread set to TRUE:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks to see if the pinned-to-thread setting is set to true.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``database contention``

The domain is subject to ``minimizing the time it takes for an application to reserve a database connection from a data source and to eliminate contention between threads for a database connection, you can add the Pinned-To-Thread property in the connection Properties list for the data source, and set its value to true.``

sdp_rule.name: JDBC statement-cache-type
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.JDBC.FILES',{})) loop $fil (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$fil,'STATEMENT_CACHE_TYPE'}) call push(@tbl,$fil) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have statement-cache-type:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the statement-cache-type setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``database contention``

The domain is subject to ``database connection and Oracle recommends setting the JDBC options Statement Cache Type for each Data Source thus in our documentation at: %BR%http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E14571_01/web.1111/e13814/topten.htm#i1145700 %BR%To configure the JDBC Connection Pool using the WebLogic Administrator Console: %BR%http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E14571_01/apirefs.1111/e13952/taskhelp/jdbc/jdbc_datasources/ConfigureTheStatementCacheForADataSource.html``

sdp_rule.name: JDBC statement-cache-size
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.JDBC.FILES',{})) loop $fil (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$fil,'STATEMENT_CACHE_SIZE'}) call push(@tbl,$fil) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have statement-cache-size:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the statement-cache-size setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``database contention``

The domain is subject to ``database connection and Oracle recommends setting the JDBC options Statement Cache Size for each Data Source thus in our documentation at: %BR%http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E14571_01/web.1111/e13814/topten.htm#i1145700 %BR%To configure the JDBC Connection Pool using the WebLogic Administrator Console: %BR%http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E14571_01/apirefs.1111/e13952/taskhelp/jdbc/jdbc_datasources/ConfigureTheStatementCacheForADataSource.html``

sdp_rule.name: Server native-io-enabled
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the native-io-enabled setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``performance issues``
The domain is subject to ``Performance issues if native IO is not set. Edit the config.xml file and set the NativeIOEnabled attribute of the Server element to "true" (NativeIOEnabled=true).``

sdp_rule.name: Cluster frontend-host
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.CLUSTERS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if missing($tbl->{$nam,'FRONTEND_HOST'}) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have cluster frontend-host set to:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the cluster names and their settings for frontend-host.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``performance issues``
The domain is subject to ``Cluster has no FrontEndHost server specified``

sdp_rule.name: Virtual-host max-post-size
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.VIRTUAL_HOSTS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if !expr('>',$tbl->{$nam,'MAX_POST_SIZE'},0) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have virtual host names for max-post-size \ set to greater than zero:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the virtual host max-post-size setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``denial-of-service attacks which is a malicious attempt to overload the server``

The domain is subject to ``a Denial-of-Service attack as a malicious attempt to overload a server with phony requests. One common type of attack is to send huge amounts of data in an HTTP POST method. To help prevent this type of attack set the Maximum Post Size greater than zero in the Oracle WebLogic Server. This attribute is set in the Console, under Servers or Virtual Hosts. If this attribute is defined for a virtual host, the values set for the virtual host override those set under Servers.``

sdp_rule.name: Server max-post-size
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.SERVERS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if !expr('>',$tbl->{$nam,'MAX_POST_SIZE'},0) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have max-post-size set to greater than \ zero:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule collects the max-post-size setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``denial-of-service attacks which is a malicious attempt to overload the server``

The domain is subject to ``a Denial-of-Service attack as a malicious attempt to overload a server with phony requests. One common type of attack is to send huge amounts of data in an HTTP POST method. To help prevent this type of attack set the Maximum Post Size greater than zero in the Oracle WebLogic Server. This attribute is set in the Console, under Servers or Virtual Hosts. If this attribute is defined for a virtual host, the values set for the virtual host override those set under Servers.``

sdp_rule.name: Server max-open-sock-count
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var ($tbl,@tbl) = (getHcveFact('DOMAIN.CONFIG.SERVERS',{})) loop $nam (keys($tbl)) {if !expr('>',$tbl->{$nam,'MAX_OPEN_SOCK_COUNT'},0) call push(@tbl,$nam) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have max-open-sock-count set:',@tbl),\ 'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the max-open-sock-count setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``Too Many Open Files Error.``
The domain is subject to ``Too Many Files Error when max-open-sock-count attribute is not set``

sdp_rule.name: Config server ssl host-name-verification-ignored
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks the ssl host-name-verification-ignored setting.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``A Man in the Middle Attack.``

``This domain is running in production mode, but the HostnameVerification property has been disabled. When the HostnameVerification attribute has been disabled, Oracle WebLogic Server no longer ensures that the certificate received from a remote site matches the DNS name when making a remote SSL connection. This leaves the connection vulnerable to a man in the middle attack. ``

sdp_rule.name: JVM heapsize
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var @tbl =() loop $rec (@{getHcveFact('DOMAIN.WLST.HEAPSIZE',[])}) {if !expr('==',$rec->[1],$rec->[2]) call push(@tbl,$rec->[0]) } call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),\ join("\012",'The following do not have ``JVM parameters -Xms and -Xmx`` set \ equally:',@tbl),'protected'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule collects JVM Parameters and verifies they are set equal to each other.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``a Performance issue.``

``This domain Assess the heap capacity necessary for the application and specify equal and fixed start and maximum heap size. Use the JVM parameters "-Xms" and "-Xmx" to specify these values. This best practice may improve the performance of the system under heavy load. Refer to MOS note 874792.1 (https://support.us.oracle.com/oip/faces/secure/km/DocumentDisplay.jspx?id=874792.1) and the JVM tuning documentation (http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E24329_01/web.1211/e24390/jvm_tuning.htm#PERFM150 and http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E13150_01/jrockit_jvm/jrockit/geninfo/diagnos/bestpractices.html) for details.``

sdp_rule.name: JDBC WaitingForConnectionHighCount
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule Performance may be impacted by requests waiting for a connection.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject ``to a performance impacted by requests waiting for a connection``
``This domain is subject to a performance impact of waiting threads, the number of connections available in these connection pools should be increased.``

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks if the domain is subject to ``fix Resource Injection Exception in Interceptor``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The domain is not subject to ``EJB3 WebService Fails to compile when using static nested class`` for Oracle WebLogic Server ${DOMAIN_VERSION}.

sdp_rule.name: Issue 4844?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $PATCH_ID var $PATCH_ID = "9051649" call setHcveResult(cond(\ and(getHcveFact('DOMAIN.PATCH.8979755'),\ getHcveFact('DOMAIN.PATCH.9050041'),\ getHcveFact('DOMAIN.PATCH.9051649')),'protected',\ 'susceptible'))
